page.title: 12HOUSING IN CIRENCESTER
page.content: Most houses are now built in fields that have been dug up. They are made with concrete,bricks,cement and stone. The Council build council houses to rent to other people. It costs about Â£25,000 to build a council house today. The foundations are made of concrete and gravel.It would cost about Â£23,000 to buy a small house. Most 2 - 3 bedroomed houses cost around Â£33,000 to Â£43,000.Tiles are usually used for roofs rather than slates. About 16,000 people live in Cirencester. Most of the houses are owner occupied but there are 1,500 rented houses and 195 warden controlled flats for elderly people. Most houses have central heating, some have double glazing on the windows to help insulate. People have built over massive fireplaces in many older houses.
